title: "Maintain Your Combine: Essential Maintenance for John Deere S Series"

tasks.task: Properly maintaining a combine harvester through regular inspections and daily tasks.
subtasks: Inspect engine oil and coolant levels before the harvest season.
Check belts and chains for proper tension and wear during pre-harvest checks.
Examine the cutting platform, including knives and guards, prior to harvest.
Inspect the threshing mechanism and cleaning shoe in pre-harvest preparation.
Clean debris from the previous season in the pre-harvest checklist.
Test all lights and safety equipment before the harvest begins.
Grease all fittings daily as per manufacturer's recommendations during harvest.
Check fluid levels daily, including engine oil, hydraulic oil, and coolant during harvest.
Inspect belts and chains for proper tension every day during harvest.
Clean the radiator and other cooling components daily during harvest.
Empty the rock trap if present daily during harvest.
Check tire pressure and adjust as needed daily during harvest.
Clean the grain tank and unloading auger daily during harvest.
Clean crop residue from the machine at the end of each day post-harvest.
Check for loose or missing bolts at the end of each day post-harvest.
Inspect the header for damage or wear at the end of each day post-harvest.
Look for oil leaks and address them promptly post-harvest.
Thoroughly clean the combine after the harvest concludes.
Remove all crop residue to prevent rust and rodent damage post-harvest.
Change all fluids and filters as recommended by the manufacturer post-harvest.
Lubricate all necessary points post-harvest.
Touch up any paint chips to prevent rust post-harvest.
Store the combine in a dry, covered area if possible post-harvest.
Use a quality tarp to protect the combine from elements if stored outside post-harvest.
Troubleshoot uneven cutting by checking sickle sections and guards.
Adjust concave clearance and rotor speed for inconsistent threshing.
Inspect sieves and adjust fan speed for grain loss issues.
Check fuel filters and lines for contamination in engine problems.
Check for leaks and verify fluid levels for hydraulic issues.

tasks.task: Seek professional help if unsure about maintenance tasks.
